title: Definitions
context: CONSTRUCTION OF CHAPTER §806-1 Definitions. In this chapter: &ldquo;act&rdquo; or &ldquo;doing of an act&rdquo; includes &ldquo;omission to act&rdquo;; &ldquo;the court&rdquo; unless a contrary intention appears means the court before which the trial is had; &ldquo;the offense&rdquo; means the specific offense constituted by the acts or omissions of the accused as distinguished from &ldquo;the transaction&rdquo; which means the particular acts, facts, and circumstances which distinguish the offense committed from other offenses of the same nature. [L 1915, c 215, pt of §2; RL 1925, §4021; RL 1935, §5494; RL 1945, §10795; RL 1955, §258-1; HRS §711-1; ren L 1972, c 9, pt of §1]
